subject: Re: [junit] testing 'Applets' using either htmlunit or jWebUnit
msgSnippet: Hi I m presently extending webtest [1] to test applets in the context of an html browsing session: I use webtest to navigate through the web app up to a page
messageBody:
Hi

I'm presently extending webtest [1] to test applets in the context of
an html browsing session: I use webtest to navigate through the web app
up to a page containing an applet, then have webtest launch the applet
and test it with a jemmy [2] scenario. Once the applet / the test
scenario completes, webtest can proceed with further test of the web
app.

Give it a try, any recent build of webtest contains the necessary
support, even though it is not yet documented ;-(
I'll be glad for any feedback!

Happy testing
dna


[1] <http://webtest.canoo.com>
[2] <http://jemmy.netbeans.org/>

> Hi all,
> We use applets on a few web pages within our
> J2EE based web app. Is there any unit testing
> framework available that supports applets? Appreciate
> your help.
>
> I know htmlunit simulates a browser environment, but
> not sure if it supports applets.
>
> Thank you
> Srini
